column2: COLORADO DMV TEST
Question Text
1. This road sign means:
2. Diamond-shaped signs:
column6: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 3. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.
column6: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
column8: stare straight ahead at all times.
column10: maintain focus toward the left of the road.

column2: 4. A flashing red light means:
column6: The light will soon change to steady red.
column10: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 5. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
6. This road sign means:
column4: All traffic must turn right at next intersection
column6: Right turn on red light permitted

column2: 7. This road sign means:
8. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: speed up to beat the red light.
column6: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.
column8: proceed with caution through the intersection.
column10: stop and wait for the light to change.

column2: 9. This white sign means you:
column4: may turn left only on a green arrow.
column6: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.
column8: must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.

column2: 10. When changing lanes, you should:
column4: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.
column8: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.
column10: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.

column2: 11. This sign means drivers should:
column6: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road they wish to enter.
column8: proceed at normal speed through the upcoming intersection.
column10: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.

column2: 12. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its left lane.
column6: must turn into its right lane.
column8: must go to the next intersection.

column2: 13. When the road is slippery, you should:
column4: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.
column6: use your emergency or parking brake.

column2: 14. This traffic sign warns you about:
column10: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.

column2: 15. Regulatory signs are:
16. If your turn signals fail, you should use _____ to indicate your intention to turn.
17. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column6: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column8: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column10: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.

column2: 18. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column10: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 19. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
column6: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column8: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.

column2: 20. This sign means:
21. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column6: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column8: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 22. When driving in icy or snowy conditions, to avoid crashes drivers should:
column4: get off the highway as quickly as possible.
column6: reduce speed and increase following distance.
column8: add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction.
column10: engage 4 wheel drive on the vehicle.

column2: 23. When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
column4: cross the tracks as slowly as possible.
column8: speed up to beat the train.
column10: yield to all trains at the crossing.

column2: 24. When a traffic signal light turns green, you should:
column8: yield the right-of-way to larger vehicles.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
